_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The consequences of someone saying that: They make it difficult for those who rely on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One
Their heart is full of hostility
An individual with wrong view is reborn in one of two places: hell or the animal realm
The high distinctions achieved by gentle: They realize the fruit of stream-entry
They realize the fruit of once-return
They realize the fruit of non-return
They realize the fruit of perfection
They ripen the seeds for rebirth in a heavenly state
The three kinds of teachers in the world: A teacher who has not reached the goal of the ascetic life for which they went forth from the lay life to homelessness, and when they teach disciples, the disciples proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction

A teacher who has not reached the goal of the ascetic life for which they went forth from the lay life to homelessness, and when they teach disciples, the disciples don’t proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction

A teacher who has reached the goal of the ascetic life for which they went forth from the lay life to homelessness, and when they teach disciples, the disciples proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction
The consequences of the actions of the t: For the first kind of teacher, it’s like a man who makes advances on a woman though she pulls away, or embraces her though she turns her back
For the second kind of teacher, it’s like someone who abandons their own field and presumes to weed someone else’s field
For the third kind of teacher, it’s like someone who cut off an old bond, only to create another new bond
The qualities of a teacher who does not: A Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha
A mendicant who is accomplished in ethics
A teacher under whom a disciple achieves the first absorption
A teacher under whom a disciple achieves the second absorption
A teacher under whom a disciple achieves the third absorption
A teacher under whom a disciple achieves the fourth absorption
A teacher under whom a disciple extends and projects the mind toward knowledge and vision
A teacher under whom a disciple understands that there is no return to any state of existence
The consequences of reprimanding a teach: When someone reprimands such a teacher, the reprimand is false
When someone reprimands such a teacher, the reprimand is baseless
When someone reprimands such a teacher, the reprimand is illegitimate
When someone reprimands such a teacher, the reprimand is blameworthy
